By the way: I noticed one minor possible blooper --- when discussing about a camper for his mother, a dog suddenly jumps up to Pitt and that frightened him somewhat while uttering the four-letter f word, and then continued with his lines but with a smile on his face --- I don't think it was part of the script, though. Did anybody see this as well? Anyways --- great movie, I like it more than Pulp Fiction!

title: A Fierce Joyride of Coincidence
content: This film is a very visual form of every great O. Henry story. While not quite as well put together as "Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels," this film has got it where it counts and rolls very well onto the screen as a celebration of the unexpected and how coincidence and mishaps affect us all, even the makers of the best plans. A fun, fast film, not quite the same enjoyment level as the Guy Ritchie's film which proceeded it (Lock, Stock...) but better than most of what airs in the U.S.A. Ritchie proves that he is most decidely the fresh blood american box offices need, along with Troy Duffy, whose excellent work, Boondock Saints, should be viewed with Ritchie's films as a new approach to Noir. The entire cast make the film fun, and it is great to see Vinnie Jones return as a merciless hitman. A great cast, some fun turns, and an all out joy to watch. Can we get some of this stateside, moviemakers, other than the excellent aforementioned Duffy?

title: good fun
content: It is Quentin Tarantino a la "Trainspotting" style. Taste of British humor makes the big difference from other modern "tough guys" films of American origin. Acting excellent, in particular Dennis Farina is in another amazing role after "Get Shorty".

title: richie does it again
content: Snatch is the followup movie to lock stock and is guy richies second movie i think. Snatch does remind me a lot of lock stock in the sense that you have this group of criminals all wanting the same thing. Though this time around it is a big old diamond, brad pitt joins the crew as irish talking micky. Now micky is a boxer and creates some comic relife with the accent he has chosen. We also have statham as irish. Stephen graham. Vinnie jones and lenny james. There are some great one liners and a lot of fun to be had as well as rough punching and some sad scenes in places. Overall snatch is another richie classic.

title: The Best
content: I love Snatch ! I like Lock Stock but not wow. I wow Snatch. It is the best and I have watched it time and time again. The cast is great. Brad Pitt scrubbing in from Hollywood with an majority British cast. Mike Reid is fab. His character suits him as if it was written for him. I like Turkish and Tommy. The bond between the two is strong and jumps through the screen. I don't want to yap on about this movie too much. I just love it. You may not. Just watch it and watch it again. Guy Richie has excelled to my highest standard. Movies are a very personal and this is my personal best. I like the music tracks. Even Vinnie Jones who is not the best at stringing words together plays a good role as Bullet tooth Tony.

title: Excellent comedy (funnier version of ANALYZE THIS)
content: In my expeience of movies this movie is the funniest movie i have ever seen. Eventhough i hate comedy movies this movie has single handedly changed my opinion. Its a must see for anyone who wishes to laugh till their nerve pops.

title: A big mess
content: This movie is one of the biggest messes shown on screen. It's confusing, filled with turns and twists which portrays life and this particular plot so well. The movie is hilarious in a serious and dark way. One of my favorite movies by Ritchie and one of my favorite roles for both Statham and honestly Brad Pitt. The latter plays such a different character, he's my favorite in the movie. Talk about a luxurious cast with Statham, Pitt, Del Toro, Vinnie, Alan Ford and much more. Great cast and fantastic acting / directing, really recommend you see it!

title: Fantastic
content: One of the best English films. Fantastic writing and the direction is unreal.Start to finish. Tense with comedy

title: Superb!
content: This film has everything. Writing this review in 2019 and this is still the best British film to this day!If you haven't seen it then i highly recommend this to anyone no matter what your taste in film is because this film has it all!

title: A great movie to watch
content: This movie is COOL.From the beginning until the end it's cool.It has all that i like and i want to watch on a movie.Ritchie did a great job.A lot of characters,a fast plot that it won't make you bored,clever lines,cool jokes,gangsters,boxers,thieves.The entire movie has the cool element in it.Tarantino is a big influence to Ritchie and that's visible so if you like Tarantino's work you will like and that movie.It has a "Pulp Fiction" mood but in the British way and style.The cast is great(some actors played and in "lock,stock"),Ritchie did some very good choices.Just if you look at the cover you will understand that these guys are not joking. Jones,the baddest guy on earth,is the right man to play "Bullet Tooth Tony".He convinces you only with a look. Statham as "Turkish" is the man,with this "i don't care about nothing" face. Pitt plays "Mickey" a gypsy boxer,very good performance.Nothing less than you except.A great movie to watch.10/10

title: Clever movie
content: I guess this movie has the essence of the pure and sophisticated comedy, without parodies or aggressive jokes (which are sometimes very funny either). The movie itself is very unusual, crazy, alternative, and reminds very vaguely the atmosphere of Pulp Fiction.The beginning is intricate, but as the happenings go on, the relations between the characters get more solid and the situations, funnier.The acting couldn't be better; all of them were perfect for the roles, but Brad Pitt raised the level even more.I recommend this movie for the ones who are open-minded, by the fact that this is not a typical commercial movie; it innovates in some aspects and the result was a clever and sophisticated movie that may not be the taste of everybody.

title: Guy Ritchie has done it again!
content: After such a classic piece of cinema, like "Lock, Stock...", you'd think the pressure of making his second full length film, might weigh down the plot or direction. I'm happy to say that Guy Ritchie has done it again, making a movie that will no doubt become a classic action film. Set in London, "Snatch" is the story of Turkish and Tommy, two unlicenced boxing promoters who get in trouble with a gangster named Brick Top. Turkish's boxer, Gorgeous George is supposed to go down in the 4th round but when Tommy and George got into some hot water with a group of gypsies led by Mickey O'Neil (Brad Pitt, in one of his best performances). George gets into a fight with Mickey and Mickey knocks George's lights into the next world. Turkish decides to substitute Mickey for George in the big fight but when Mickey doesn't go down in the 4th, Turkish and Tommy sink deeper into trouble.In another plot line, jewish diamond thief, Franky Four Fingers (Benico Del Toro) steals a diamond "the size of a fist" and is then robbed buy 3 stupid jewelry wholesalers and their crazy gypsie dog. But they run into one small problem, the case with the stone in it is chained to Franky's arm, so they take Franky with them to meet the buyer, russian ex-KGB assassin, Boris the Blade. Back in the USA, Cousin Avi (Denis Farina, playing another foul mouthed mobster) finds out that Franky has been robbed and he won't get his giant diamond. Avi flies to London and must find his 86 karat stone with the help of Bullet Tooth Tony (Vinnie Jones) a man who took six bullets to the head and is still tickin'. He even had some of the bullets molded into teeth to replace the one's he lost. Sound complicated? Don't worry, it's not. With his brilliant directing style, Richie has made a movie that will make you laugh, cry and maybe even puke if you have a Really weak stomach. Plus some of the best boxing sequences filmed since "Raging Bull" Any way you slice it, "Snatch" is a winner! 10/10

title: A movie to be re watched
content: This movie is amazing, all the actors fit well in it. The story is really funny and have its own twists, as you would expect from a Guy Ritchie movie. Much like it's predecessor, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, it has a few story lines that will connect in the end for a great ending and with a few actors from the previous movies as well. Jason Statham is great as the Turkish, Brad Pitt is really funny, and Brick Top is a great villain, great job done by Alan Ford.One of my favorite movies of all time, I never get bored watching it again and again.I highly recommend to watch this movie. Best movie from Guy Ritchie

title: A movie gem in hiding
content: Had never heard of this movie and feeling lucky we picked the movie, Snatch. I loved it although at some points the accents made it difficult to understand the dialogue. Brad Pitt though, played his mushed mouth, multi accented dialogue to perfection. The action was non-stop and this is an entertaining movie. .

title: Stealing On and Off Screen
content: Greetings again from the darkness.  Madonna's hubby is no dummy.  He steals from the best.  The influence of Tarantino is obvious, but in "Snatch" and "Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels" I see a great deal of Scorcese as well.  When you learn from these two and throw in a twisted, darkly comical screenplay and amazing acting from the ensemble cast, Guy Ritchie provides us with this years best guilty pleasure!  I found myself alterately laughing and squirming with the unique mix of violence and a remarkably high number of scenes where at least one character is asking himself, "What am I doing here?".  Alan Ford steals his scenes as Brick Top - a perfect name for such a charming guy.  Brad Pitt turns in a beautiful performance as a character right out of the Paul Bunyon school of Tall Tales.  Although brief in screen time, Benicio Del Toro again shows why he is well on his way to stardom.  I just hope he continues to be very selective on his roles and doesn't turn in to Kevin Bacon, god forbid.  No real tidbit on this other than make sure to enjoy the dialogue.  It is, for the most part, easily understood if one concentrates.  I did not find it to be a distraction, and I am from TEXAS! Looking forward to more from Guy Ritchie, but I do hope he learns to minimize the visual distractions (clever camera work) to the point that it does not interfere with the story.

title: Amazing, we need to see more movies like this!
content: Snatch is an amazingly witty film that comes together ironically perfectly and unexectedly so at the end.  Statham does a great job narrating (and is SO great!) And overall the movie is one that can me watched a million times. I can't wait for another great one like this, hopefully with Statham.

title: THE FIRST GOOD FILM OF 2000
content: Snatch the new film by Guy Ritchie is a mainstream masterpiece. And without doubt the best movie, not to mention most descent move of the year. Almost all movies this year thus far have been complete c**p. All hype and not living up to its word, something which Hollywood is fond of. However Snatch rises above all that jargon and comes out as a sly comedy that is well acted and even better written. I came into the theater and kept telling myself that this wasn't a direct sequel (although it did use most of the same actors from Lock Stock) and to watch it as if I never knew Guy Ritchie's work, and it worked. But some viewers might find this hard due to the fact that Lock Stock was such a good movie, which it was. But in my opinion this was better. The movie itself is very high paced and fun. So if you live in the U.K and have a hole burning in your pocket, go see Snatch. Your pocket and your head will thank you.

title: Awesome `guy' film!!
content: I say this because I don't believe women like these types of flicks.  About various international thugs, crooks, and contract killers, who all end up involved in trying to sell an 84 carat diamond in some way or another.  Lots of humor and killing and swearing.....guy stuff!!  A

title: Excellent
content: I heard good things going into this movie and wasn't disappointed at all. This was done by the same person who did "Lock, Stock, and two smoking barrels" (which I have yet to see) but it have a great story line, many creative plot twists, brilliant direction and camera work. Brad Pitt's charachter Mickey wasn't too hard to understand, but if you do have a hard time understanding his dialect, thats ok, thats the point.In closing, I'd sum it up as more of a European "Pulp Fiction" with a thicker story and better direction.

title: Awesome Movie!!!!
content: This movie was so good!!!  It was not exactly what I expected it to be, but then again I really had no clear picture about what it was.  It was kind of about diamond-smuggling, after all, the whole movie revolves around a humongous diamond.  But it is very hard to say exactly what the movie is about.  It has several different plot lines that all weave together in to one story.  It was very funny, I laughed until my stomach hurt, and it had THE BEST ending I have seen in a movie in a long time.  The acting was superb, Brad Pitt was hilarious, along with all the other actors I had never seen before.  You have GOT to see this movie!!!

title: One of the most unique movies of the year.
content: There should be more movies like these.  When i saw this movie, i was forced to watch it again, not only because it was smart, funny in a dark way, but the acting by the cast was truly amazing. Boris the Blade is my favorite character in that movie, i saw him in MI:2, i didn't know he could act that well, he is a great actor, and his Alan Ford (Brick Top), he is one of the meanest SOB's i ever saw, his acting is oscar worthy, especially his face expressions.As for Brad Pitt, i didn't know he could work as a pikey, but he did a pretty good job, and Benicio Del Toro, i don't know why people said he was so good, i don't see anything special in his acting.  Whoever chose this cast was indeed a genius.  Guy Ritchie should be given a lot of credit for this movie, most people say it's like LS&2SB, trust me this is way better. Those of you people who haven't seen this movie, you don't now what you are missing.

title: Periwinkle Blue
content: A great movie overall I love this movie one of my favourites, with its iconic quotes, great cinematography and memorable story line.

title: Dynamic Cinema 101
content: It might be the movie I've seen the most in my young life. Guy Ritchie really put up a beauty with Snatch. Really, it's one of the best entertaining movies i've seen in my life. There is many reasons to that. First of all, you have a polyphonic plot with a lot of good and bad guys. Who cares if they are stereotypes? Really...it's cinema. The editing follows the incredible speed of the movie. Fast cuts, active camera, lots and lots of plans are Ritchie's forte here.Cinema purists might not like it, but it comes down to what are you researching in cinema. Sometimes it's good to ask yourself questions, but sometimes it's good to see a well made, dynamic, fun entertainment. This is also the one liner paradise, like most of the masculine movies anyway.

title: A funny non-genuine comedy
content: Snatch got me from the very beginning, because of its original dialogs and colorful characters, as well as because of the funny narrative. Brad Pitt and Rade Serbedija play brilliant, and imagine that both characters are against their origins.The film has a very interesting plot. Some people compare it to Pulp Fiction. In my opinion, Snatch is a little more original, but I definitely prefer PF. However, Snatch can be considered a lighter version of Tarantino's breakthrough or even the British equivalent.All in all, Snatch is an absolutely amusing film, both for its comedic and action scenes. I highly recommend it to those who think that hardcore crime moves (ie without humor) are sometimes boring or typical.

title: If it's not broke, don't fix it.
content: It's good to see that Guy Ritchie's next movie is set far from London's criminal underworld, because it's fair to say that he has probably wrung every last drop of entertainment from the (identical) subject matter of his first two features.  In fact, he wrung the flannel dry, because one of the twists in SNATCH (an attempt to sell goods back to the person they were stolen from), is a direct lift from LOCK, STOCK & TWO SMOKING BARRELS; Now, I don't mind this sort of thing going on when an old idea is re-processed, but, as a writer, if you find yourself stealing from your previous work so soon, you don't ask how much is left in the well, you wonder how much was in there in the first place.SNATCH contains the same frenetic pace and kinetic direction as its predecessor, and a gritty, bleached-out colour, while having much more of a sixties feel (despite the surfeit of 70s/80s music), and containing a lot more quirky (or flashy, depending on your opinion) touches.   Where this movie does improve on LS&TSB, however, is in injecting a potent dose of pathos into the necessary elements of the plot.   It's a shame, then, that a certain sense of self-satisfaction on the part of writer-director Ritchie is evident in the over-elaborate stylisation.The strands of the story bind together well as the movie approaches its climax (although the conclusion of the black guys' tale is a little lame), and Ritchie coaxes a far better performance from Vinnie Jones than the one he gave in LS&TSB.   Brad Pitt is especially good in a role that he should have stunk in.I liked this movie a lot, although you might not think so from what I've written.   Maybe that's a testimony to Ritchie's undoubted ability to deliver a well-made and entertaining story that is strong enough to overcome shortcomings that will, hopefully, be addressed as his career progresses.

title: Good, better, Snatch.
content: A truly outstanding movie, with marvellous characters and a great cast. The directing is enjoyfully intense, creating an atmosphere of real-life yet maintaining its surreality through some almost cartoonlike scenes. Even the dialogue is witty not to mention the superb music, which truly enriches the movie for the better. Most importantly, this is a concise moviegoing package that does not let the viewer down. See it and Enjoy!

title: excellent
content: This has got be one of the funniest ,none out right comedies i've ever seen,With an array of characters ranging from Turkish to Bullet tooth tony ,brick top ,mickey and all the characters that were put together to make up the movie. Guy Ritchie really did it good this time, this coming up after the excellent Lock Stock &Two smoking barrels , i just hope that hew keeps on improving cause he can only go up from here.The dialog was insane,culminated by the English accents and British humor, i doubt if such a movie would have worked using the same script but with American dialog, it just wouldn't Be the same.All round it's a great movie and has become one of my personal favorites.

title: i have never seen brad pitt in such a good movie
content: ive never seen brad pitt in such a great role. its guy ritchey at his best i loved the movie its been my favourite since ive seen it i loved benicio del toro too he was tremendous ive never seen such a good movie as snatch i recommend people to see this movie.

title: Better than Lock,Stock and everything that followed
content: This is the film that Guy got right after the tester film that was Lock, Stock... and then went on to make flaw after flaw.The Mockney filmmaker with his silver spoon in his mouth must prey to the gods for the this one ever coming to the screen as this is one heck of a film with so many quotable lines and 3 dimensional characters.Well worth the repeatable watch ***

title: great fun!!!!
content: As i haven't seen "Lock, stock...", I can't complain that the two are all the same. I can just say that i loved this movie! Brad Pitt was absolutely hilarious, the accent is the funniest I've heard in a long time. It was rather violent, but it was done in a very elegant way. such a confusing plot, you have to concentrate a bit, but it is very funny indeed. highly recommended, also for girls :)

title: Good film, but a bit heavy on the accents
content: I know that Brad Pitt's thick accent in the film is a running joke throughout the movie, but his isn't the only one. Most of the actors are hard to understand. However, definitely worth seeing, and one for the DVD collection.

title: Now this is a good movie!
content: I can't tell you how great this film is, you gotta see it for your self. (sorry if it sounds like the matrix tagline) This film is packed with action and funny jokes.  Really funny.  Storyline is great, how these characters link to each other in some way or another is just brilliant.  Many great actors here, my favorites are Tony, Turkish, Mickey, Franky, Vinny, Sol, Tommy...the list just goes on and on.  NEVER a boring moment in the movie, no nice looking girls in the film and yet it's an excellent film for guys since me and my buddies all enjoyed it very much.  I rented "Fight Club", "Snatch", and "Dude, where is my car?" (i know, i shouldn't, gave up in 10 minutes), and in my opinion "Snatch" is a more entertaining film then "fight club", because the flow is smoother, and there are just too many good actors in Snatch.  Benicio Del Toro didn't get alot of scenes but he shined in every one of them.My all time favourite movie was "Matrix", now "Snatch" is up there with it. Have you ever watched a movie and afterwards you couldn't stop thinking about it? then you know how I felt.

title: Very entertaining!
content: This is only Guy Ritchie's second film, and he had already showcased his storytelling abilities. While his debut film, "Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels," hinted at his unique directorial traits, this film takes them to new heights. It is undeniably a much better showing than his first feature.Not only is it more action-packed, but it also has a more coherent narration. Most importantly, the writing on every character produces effective outcomes, which was lacking in his previous work and left me unsatisfied, to be honest.Furthermore, I appreciate the humour this time. Even though It maintains the same brand of black comedy as before, but it somehow feels more refined and works its magic, as one would expect it to.

title: Guy Ritchie's Best
content: Snatch is a fixed up cocktail of just the right ingredients. From the unlucky underground boxing manager (Jason Statham) to the inarticulate fighting gypsy (Brad Pitt) to completely incompetent jewel thief's, these guys make up a cast of characters that are utterly hilarious when put together.The witty dialogue makes the movie what it is. I feel wittier just by watching it. As an American, its just amusing to hear these quick-tongued Brits go at it. Nearly every scene involves a quip or sly remark. Cop: "What's in the car?" Turkish: "Two seats and a steering wheel."But beyond the cunning wit of the dialog, you have a story of a group of lowlifes, thugs, gangsters, hit men, and gypsies all trying to get the same thing, whether they know it or not. Although, its more like two completely separate stories are being played out simultaneously, but end up converging into one in the end. I won't get into how or why, you'll just have to watch it.My only quarrel with the film is, if you've seen Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, you'll notice a lot of similarities between the two movies. In fact they're almost exactly the same in terms of general plot techniques. Even used some of the same actors filling similar roles. While this isn't enough to discredit this film, I actually think Snatch is far superior, it makes me wonder what Guy Ritchie was thinking.

title: Pure fun
content: While the acting is a bit hit and miss, this film still kept me laughing and cringing the whole time. Brad Pitt is a standout

title: Pitt is hilarious
content: Brad Pitt can really be funny. He is a bare knuckled Irish boxer Mickey O'Neil and he nails the brogue so well that I was convinced that he was from the Emerald Isle. Unlike his ex-wife Madonna, Guy Ritchie actually has talent. He directs Snatch in a non linear fashion and with enough off beat dialogue to invite comparisons to Quentin Tarantino.Benicio del Toro is jewel thief Frankie four fingers and he is in London to sell a huge diamond that he has stolen. He gets double crossed by gangsters who run a dog fighting ring and expand into boxing. Mickey winds up fighting for them and when they lose money due to the Irishman not taking a fall, all hell breaks loose.Several kidnappings, killings and every crime known to man soon follow as Snatch becomes a full fledged, violent ride with a satisfying conclusion.

title: A Music Video Populated by P.G. Wodehouse Characters Updated to Modern London's Crime World
content: Cinematic prototypes lean toward having an agelessness about them, an idiosyncratic appeal that exceeds years and settings. A relatively new model has been trying its frontier, the consciously stylized gangster. These incessantly stylish, exaggeratedly talkative, morally vague antiheroes have crowded the cinema backdrop. An exciting cross-reference to the question of whether or not the stylistically cutting-edge criminal is consistent and attention-grabbing enough to last is put into high-gear in Guy Ritchie's sophomore raid on the modern London gangland. Packed with jump-cuts, high shutter speed, a loud multi-generational pop soundtrack, harsh locales, style-sprayed dialogue and heaps of comic irony, Snatch. can be seen as the premier template for hyper-stylized testosterone cinema of and since the new millennium, except a closer going-over---and you'd not be in the minority if you gave it numerous---exposes something even more thrilling.Snatch. is essentially a manic fusion, mongrelizing the Gen X and Y movie gangster with a varied range of archetypal potboiler constituents. Indeed, there are enough quaint, glib villains in it to give Mamet, Tarantino and even Scorsese at least a blip on the radar screen of their challengers, but at its core is a classic caper comedy. It's not ridiculous, actually, to picture Cary Grant playing Mickey fifty, sixty years ago were that heyday the time for this fast-paced amalgam of the underworld mythologies of the fixed boxing match and the diamond heist. Ritchie is the cinematic counterpart of a disc jockey, sampling traditional British thriller plotting and mixing it with ultra-modern atmospheric ingredients to form a witty and exhilarating mélange.Ritchie's rearing in commercials and music videos give Snatch and its chronic freeze-frames a gasping pace, owing to cinematographer Tim Maurice-Jones and editor Jon Harris, who move heaven and earth. John Murphy's score lightheartedly varies on Jewish and Slavic formulas that sustains a tongue-in-cheek tone of buoyancy, at the same time the production design suggests one after another frayed London lower-class scene with stark naturalism. Ritchie keeps everything whirling frantically and cheerfully along, with all the audacious excitement of a bright kid intoxicated by the utter thrill of flying his own kite.The chaotic, tricky plot is given its much-needed bookends by Turkish, an unlicensed boxing promotoer attempting to expand by dealing with formidable figures like many-tentacled crime lord Brick Top. In an effort to rig an impending match for Brick Top, Turkish solicits Brad Pitt's movie-stealing gypsy Mickey, who appears incapable of correctly taking a dive.Across town, a flawless gem has been stolen by Benicio Del Toro's unassuming Frankie Four Fingers, who is expected to deliver it to America for Cousin Avi. Though, as one might imagine, there are snags: Rade Serbedzija's calculating Boris The Blade wants the diamond, and it's up to hired gun Bullet Tooth Tony help retrieve it.As the film begins to unfold, the various cliques of characters appear to trail independent fates until Ritchie's cunning script lures them together in the last 40 minutes. Less domino-like in structure than Lock, Stock, Snatch manages these innumerable brackets of people and interlaces their paths. The dialogue is lively like its predecessor's, though cheekier instead of riotous, while composed in the same breed of Cockney Runyonesque.The quality of more peripheral performances is conspicuously flimsy, but let's not lose sight of the overall upshot. The performances fluctuate in quality, but all are distinguished by a good-humored liveliness. Big splashes include Dennis Farina's frustrated American Avi, excavating a cornucopia of crass-American-traveler humor, Vinnie Jones' pokerfaced drollness as a more gentlemanly, if bullet-toothed, variation on his Big Chris in Lock, Stock, and Alan Ford's menacing eccentric Brick Top. Of exclusive reference is the impeccably cast dog that features more significantly in the action than we initially expect. Less flashy, but softly holding the whole lot together, is Jason Statham's bone-dry breakthrough as Turkish, who along with his sheepish partner, the memorable Stephen Graham as Tommy, gets more than he bargained for.This indelibly quotable audience fave is far from faultless cinematic art, but it's an electrifying exercise and a halcyon cult-smash stand-out by Ritchie. For those who grieve for the old Ealing comedies or the farces of McCarey and Wilder, and don't disapprove of a spot of gunplay, blood spatter and dismemberment, or an immensity of profanity generously strewn throughout, this is a refreshing and stirring experience. May the post-modern gangster standard keep on coming, as long as they keep as imaginative, as hilarious and as absorbing as the hyperlink tapestry of Snatch.

title: indescribably delightful
content: ... but I'm going to try to describe it anyway...The characters: Every character in this film is a fabulous story alone. Sure, most of them are only one- or two-dimensional, but those dimensions we do see are hilarious, twisted, and unique. Nearly all of them are selfish, violent, mentally ill, loveable criminals.The plot: A bizarre tale of back-stabbing, lying, cheating, and all things illegal. The story twists and tangles over itself like a nasty ball of twine.The filmmaking: As surprising and entertaining as the story and people. The camera is very much a character in this movie, and made me laugh and shake my head in wonder.See this film at least ten times. I promise you'll get something new out of it with each viewing.

title: Brad Pitt
content: Oh my God Brad Pitt in this movie.First, This is one of my favorite movies.Guy Richie is amazing. His unique way of delivering a story is absolutely enthralling.He is clever, awe-inspiring and is able to keep your attention throughout the entire film.Brad Pitt was spectacular.His acting was so on point, you get completely sucked in.It was shocking, and hilarious at times.This was the first Guy Richie film I'd seen and it made me an instant fan.The scene where Brad Pitt's character is trying to get into his mother's camper, will haunt me forever. Powerful, funny and one you can watch over and over.I do own this one I felt it had to be a part of the collection.

title: A Wonderful Crime Farce
content: Friday was another movie day,  sorta catch up to see the some of them before the awards, and specifically the Foreign films since I will be attending a symposium with the foreign film nominee directors/producers at the Academy two days before the big-time awards.SNATCH is not unique in the genre of farce story telling of gangsters stepping on other gangsters while pulling off independent schemes of getting their piece of the pie the easy way.  Well, the easy way is not that easy when independent plots converge on cops-and-robbers after many laughs of robbers-and-robbers that carries the film.This is an oddly funny film once one tunes the ear to British country way of speaking.  What?  What did they say....?It is always nice to see a movie with a cast of actors who want to bubble to the top -- and clearly have their day in the roles in this movie.  Two actors were strangely placed.  First, Benicio Del Toro ("TRAFFIC") appears as Franky Four Fingers which was a distraction as I asked myself, "Where do I know that person from???  My 30cent a gallon WATER store owner in Culver City?"   And then the star with bottom billing while giving his best performance in recent filmology, none other than Brad Pitt (One Punch' Mickey ONeil ).The planned snatching of a prized diamond only sets the stage for a strange and wonderful adventure in the English craving for good, innocent crime (s) that excels in complicity all things that would shock Sherlock plots.Just tune your ears, and don't worry about One Punch' Mickey ONeil.  Only his gypsy mobile home travellers can really enjoy his jokes and dialogue.

title: Great movie. One of the best!
content: Snatch has it all! Great fighting, great actors, great storyline, goodcomedy, except beautiful women. Brad Pitt, Jason Strattham, andDenis Farina were off the wall, and histaricle! And Brad Pitts voicein the movie was amazing! A must see movie for people who likethose actors, and that genra.

title: headline
content: Although the story was split through various subplots seeing it all come together made the movie really enjoyable. seeing the antics of each group and how it affected the next added flavor to the already conflicting personalities of each character. the film is funny and the cast did a good job.

title: Packed! Must've been tough keeping the film as short as 104 minutes.
content: Definitely a film to buy for keeps! Unlike the movie "Unbreakable" (which I still maintain, should have been say 30 minutes long), this movie is packed with so much action. So much so that many scenes had to be in fast-forward, with others being omitted so that you the viewer can fill in obvious blanks. Like most sequels (if I may call it that), it borrows motifs from "Lock Stock". It however manages to remain original and (have I not mentioned yet?)very very interesting

title: Cool action-film!
content: Snatch is a very cool action-film that a few people know each other and then it will be a fight between them.I like this sort of films which fight each other and it will be a terrific fight until the end of the film.I like actor as Benicio Del Toro and Brad Pitt and they act very well and Guy Ritchies directing are fantastic! Guy Ritchie can make a action-film with much exciting and fighting and that is fun to watch.I recommended Snatch to everyone who like to watch a film with fun and action!I want to warn sensitive persons of a few violent scenes!

title: Best British Gangster film of 90's?
content: Phil's Quick Capsule Review: Guy Ritchie's finest hour, Snatch is a far more mature movie than Lock, Stock and better for it. Alan Ford steals the show as Bricktop but Statham is close behind, showing the star promise that has lead him to bigger (but not yet better) things. One of the finest British films everBest Bit: The Final FightIMDb Rating: 9/10If you liked this try: Lock, Stock (8/10); Layer Cake (8/10); RocknRolla (8/10)Phil Hobden For more reviews check out: http://www.mod-life.net/modlife/index_ugly.htm
